channel.title: Help with compile!(Rewards in commands!)
channel.description: Ok so i get a error that says: The system cannot find path specified The system cannot find path specified Press any key to continue... How can i fix this error? i am a good coder and i can reward in commands! all you need to do is supply codes or co-ordinates! PLEASE HELP ME!!! i may even rep++ if you help cause i have been stuck on this for almost 2 days!!!

item.title: Help with compile!(Rewards in commands!)
item.dc:creator: @billysmither billysmither
item.description:

[quote=“The Real Java, post:10, topic:20198”][quote author=billysmither link=topic=30646.msg356142#msg356142 date=1161984328]

Ok so i get a error that says:
The system cannot find path specified
The system cannot find path specified
Press any key to continue…
How can i fix this error?
i am a good coder and i can reward in commands! all you need to do is supply codes or co-ordinates!
PLEASE HELP ME!!! i may even rep++ if you help cause i have been stuck on this for almost 2 days!!!

so if your a good coder im sure you should be able to change the PATH on the compile.bat

hee hee :D:D:D
[/quote]

Lol Billysmither, he still needs to know how. You started as a newb too =D[/quote]
.

lol yeah i did, but i followed a guide for this

item.title: Help with compile!(Rewards in commands!)
item.dc:creator: @Psylo Psylo
item.description:
@Psylo wrote:

Ok, right click on your compile/run & compile (It’s either one of those) and choose edit now you see a text saying something close to this,
@echo off
title WarScape Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac” *.java
pause

delete that and then replace it with this,
@echo off
COLOR 08
title YOURSERVERNAME Client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_07\bin\java.exe” server
pause

Change the YOURSERVERNAME to whatever your server is called. Now go to your Java folder and see what version of jdk1.5.0 you have and then replace the bolded part of the text with your version.

I mean If you would have version 06 you would put in
@echo off
COLOR 08
title YOURSERVERNAME Client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\bin\java.exe” server
pause

I hope that explains it to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with compile!(Rewards in commands!)
item.dc:creator: @hackman hackman
item.description:
@hackman wrote:

i have it but what do i put where i see “C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_08injavac.exe” -cp . *.java i mean what is that code?[br][size=1]Posted at: October 26, 2006, 10:49:00 PM[/size][hr][quote=“DAWIGG, post:5, topic:20198”]ok press start go to my computer, properties,advanced,variables, pressadd and put

CLASSPATH
CLASSPATH=C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in;%CLASSPATH%;.

should work.[/quote]
where do i find that? SORRY I ADMIT I AM A NOOB!!! I ADMIT IT!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with compile!(Rewards in commands!)
item.dc:creator: @DAWIGG DAWIGG
item.description:
@DAWIGG wrote:

ok press start go to my computer, properties,advanced,variables, pressadd and put

CLASSPATH
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.

should work.

Read full topic
